intro: Psychotria cairoana, commonly known as the Cairo Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or undergrowth. Psychotria cairoana is also known for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to fully understand its botanical and pharmacological significance.
